results.title: Andy Warhol
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Andy Warhol was born Andrew Warhola in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, 1928. Upon graduation from Carnegie Institute of Technology, he moved to New York and began working as a commercial artist where his success in graphic arts and illustration was celebrated. This documentary begins with his early commercial work and follows his career over 20 years until his death in 1987. Contains interviews with cast members from Warhol’s films “Sleep” and “Chelsea Girls”.

results.title: Rosalie's journey
results.brief_description: The film presents Rosalie (Ngarla) Kunoth-Monks speaking for the first time in her Arrente language. It tells the other side to the film which in 1955 was one of a kind: first full colour feature film and first to feature Aboriginal actors with speaking parts. The program is about Rosalie’s life before and after ‘Jedda’, her life in central Australia as a young woman and the profound cultural challenges she faced when selected by Charles Chauvel to play the lead role in ‘Jedda’ in 1955. Includes archival footage and excerpts from ‘Jedda’ including some b&w scenes.

results.title: Marcel Duchamp: a game of chess
results.creator_credit: Jean-Marie Drot, INA France and RM Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Filmed in 1963 the program offers an in-depth dialogue between renowned artist Marcel Duchamp and film-maker Jean-Marie Drot over a game of chess and a tour of Duchamp’s first one man show at the Pasadena Art Museum in 1963. Duchamp details his life and work only 5 years before his death in a discussion of his time in the United States after fleeing France in 1915. The discussion touches on his view of the country in social and political terms as well as its impact on his own work, intermingled with visual contemplations on the progression of his artwork from painting to photographs throughout his career. Recognised for varying artistic practices which included brushes with Impressionism and Cubism, Duchamp is also largely known for his founding influence in Surrealism and Dada. Here he recounts the stages of his work with full colour shots of the relevant pieces evoking a detailed sense of the significance of these different times in his life personally, politically and most of all artistically. The game of chess which punctuates the dialogue, a passion for Duchamp throughout his career, acts as an insightful metaphor for the mental discipline he applies to his work and an avenue for its explanation and contemplation. Contains some scenes in b&w. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Donatello 1386-1466: the first modern sculptor
results.creator_credit: Ann Turner, BBC and RM Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Phaidon art collection”.
Donatello is said in this documentary to be the most versatile and imaginative of all artists of his century and he is credited with bringing the Renaissance to Italy. The intense and personal work of Donatello is examined here in terms of his vision, emotion and techniques. Most notable is his inventive techniques in his work such as was used in his relief making sculpture. Writer and art historian Charles Avery locates an obscure terra-cotta relief of Donatello’s in Florence and throughout the documentary the authentication of the work is shown. Avery discusses the work of Donatello along with sculptors Henry Moore, Elisabeth Frink, and Peter Rockwell. This documentary was made shortly after the restoration of a number of significant works by Donatello and is the first time that these works can be seen in their former glory revealing a brilliance in colour and detail not seen in recent history.

results.title: Room full of energy
results.creator_credit: Julian Harris, Paul Sabella, Ian Ferguson, Jon Savan, Martin Rosenbaum and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A Room Full of Energy was produced to familiarize children with the concept of energy and to stimulate their interest in energy conservation. Through the magic of animation, the moon comes down from the sky to reveal the marvels of energy to a young boy and girl. The film describes the nature and role of every type of energy, from wood-burning to nuclear energy, illustrating where each comes from and how it is used. Music by Rick Elger.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Julian Harris, Paul Sabella, Ian Ferguson, Jon Savan, Martin Rosenbaum and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Roger Corman: Hollywood's wild angel
results.brief_description: Roger Corman, the king of low budget exploitation, originally directed films with American International Pictures; up to nine or ten a year at his peak. He later decided to concentrate mainly on producing and selected young and up-and-coming actors and film students to work on his films. Featured in this documentary are nine of the Corman graduates who have gone on to make a name for themselves. Some of the people featured are Joe Dante, Jonathan Demme, Peter Fonda, Ron Howard and Martin Scorsese. Corman and the graduates talk about the elements a Corman/New World picture must have to succeed. Various filmmakers and actors tell of what it is like to work with Roger. “Hollywood’s Wild Angel” also includes approximately twenty film excerpts, mostly in the form of film trailers. Narrated by Michael Wager, edited by Harvey Greenstein and Christian Blackwood. Title song ‘Hollywood Dreams’ composed and performed by Rick Lock and Cathy Chamberlain.

results.title: Rodeo cowboy
results.brief_description: Takes an intimate look at the men who make their living riding in rodeos, their dreams, their disappointments and their physical injuries. Being a rodeo cowboy is an adventurous and challenging life and although only a few ever make any real money, most would not trade for anything else. The camaraderie and dependence of friend upon friend and man upon animal are the motivations that hold them together. Photographed by Rick Freidberg and Mort “Kai” Schuman. Features soundtrack of original songs by Tim McIntire.

results.title: Room at the top
results.creator_credit: Jack Clayton, John Woolf and Remus Films
results.brief_description: Based on John Braine’s best-seller and directed by Jack Clayton, the top-notch cast, steamy sex scenes and candid exploration of class-divided Britain had critics hailing it as one of the most vivid stories of modern times. Determined to make it to the top, returned serviceman, Joe Lampton (Laurence Harvey) pursues the daughter of the richest man in town (Heather Sears). At the same time, irresistibly drawn to an older, married woman (Simone Signoret), Lampton becomes tangled in a web of lies and deceit which can only end in tragedy. Nominated for six Oscars and honoured with Academy Awards for Best Actress and Best Screenplay, this film is truly a great British classic.
